sentence.Network_en: The letter merely restated the law of the land.
sentence.Network_cn: 这封信只不过重复了一下土地法。

sentence.Network_en: This merely strengthens our resolve to win the league.
sentence.Network_cn: 这只会更加坚定我们赢得联赛的决心。

sentence.Network_en: The King has merely given the politicians enough rope to hang themselves.
sentence.Network_cn: 国王只不过是给了这些政客自缚的绳子。

entry.def: You use merely to emphasize that something is only what you say and not better, more important, or more exciting.

example.ex: Michael is now merely a good friend...
example.tran: 迈克尔现在仅仅是个不错的朋友而已。

example.ex: Francis Watson was far from being merely a furniture expert...
example.tran: 弗朗西斯·沃森远远不止是个家具行家。

entry.tran: 只不过，仅仅(用于强调数量之小)
entry.def: You use merely to emphasize that a particular amount or quantity is very small.

example.ex: The brain accounts for merely three per cent of body weight.

entry.def: You use not merely before the less important of two contrasting statements, as a way of emphasizing the more important statement.

example.ex: The team needs players who want to play cricket for England, not merely any country that will have them...
example.tran: 球队需要的是想为英格兰而战的板球选手，而不是愿为任何国家打球的选手。

example.ex: His were not merely crimes of theft but of violence against elderly people.
example.tran: 他所犯的不止是偷窃罪，而是针对老年人的暴力犯罪。

sentences.sentence: "it is simply a matter of time"

auth_sentence.content: True or not, the wording is merely sensationalism.
auth_sentence.res_content: True or not, the wording is merely sensationalism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: True or not, the wording is merely sensationalism.

Sentence.sentence: The traditional textbook merely serves as a skeleton.
This isn't a lament (伤感) - or not merely a lament - for bygone times.

To classify parenting as a personal choice for which there is no collective responsibility is not merely to ignore the social benefits of good parenting; really, it is to steal those benefits because they accrue (不断积累) to the whole of society as today's children become tomorrow's productive citizenry (公民).
In devising a way to assess hope scientifically, Doctor Snyder went beyond the simple notion that hope is merely the sense that everything will turn out all right.

sentences.en: I merely suggested you should do it again.There's no need to get annoyed.
sentences.cn: 我只是建议你应该重新做, 你用不着为此而不高兴。

sentences.en: Do you really want to go or are you merely being amiable?
sentences.cn: 你是真的想去呢, 还是仅仅为了表示友好?

jushi.english: I merely suggested you should do it again.There's no need to get annoyed.
jushi.chinese: 我只是建议你应该重新做,你不需要为此而不高兴。

jushi.english: They were so poor that they did not live but merely existed.
jushi.chinese: 他们穷得只能算生存,不能算生活。
